department_name: Kern County Public Health Services Department, Environmental Health Division

grading_system.description: 100-point deduction system with letter grades (A/B/C) and closure below 75 points. Each inspection starts with 100 points and violations deduct points (major: 5 points, minor: 3 points, non-critical: 1 point).

inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: B and C grades can request rescore inspection; mandatory closure and reinspection for scores below 75
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Letter grade cards must be posted conspicuously in facility windows during all hours of operation; inspection reports available for public review

fire_safety_authority.department_name: Kern County Fire Department - Fire Prevention Division
fire_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial Fire Suppression Hood Systems require permits and inspections
fire_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Annual fire and life safety inspections

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CRFC) based on FDA Food Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County conducts inspections - Kern County Environmental Health Division performs all food facility inspections
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Chapter 8.58 of Kern County Code establishes grading ordinance; implemented in 2007

confidence_notes: Comprehensive official documentation found including NACCHO case study with detailed grading system information, official Kern County health department website, and municipal code references. Letter grading system verified with specific point values and thresholds.
verification_notes: All key aspects verified through official sources including the detailed NACCHO case study specifically examining Kern County's food facility grading ordinance and official county websites.
